main event: An observer sighted a yellow light in the sky near Kernville, California, which appeared to move in a straight line, make a turn, and then disappear at around 11:30 PM PDT on July 31, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as being about twice the size of the largest visible star,The object hovered for several minutes before disappearing,It was reported that radar contact showed a target believed to be an airliner traveling at 100 knots,Dr. J. Allen Hynek concluded that pursuing the case further did not seem profitable,The exact nature of the sighting remains undetermined with conflicting data.
witness description: A 67-year-old male and a 63-year-old female, both from Kernville, California.
